name: mongodb-vscode
description: Connect to MongoDB and Atlas directly from your VS Code environment, navigate your databases and collections, inspect your schema and use playgrounds to prototype queries and aggregations.

scripts.test: pnpm run test-webview && pnpm run test-extension
scripts.vscode:prepublish: pnpm run clean && pnpm run compile:constants && pnpm run compile:resources && webpack --mode production
scripts.check: pnpm run lint && pnpm run depcheck

chatParticipants.name: MongoDB
chatParticipants.description: Ask anything about MongoDB, from writing queries to questions about your cluster.

commands.name: query
commands.description: Ask how to write MongoDB queries or pipelines. For example, you can ask: "Show me all the documents where the address contains the word street".

commands.name: docs
commands.description: Ask MongoDB-related questions and find answers in the official documentation.

disambiguation.description: The user is asking for assistance or information related to MongoDB.
examples: Explain this MongoDB query.

How do I use $lookup in MongoDB?

view/item/context.when: view == mongoDBConnectionExplorer && (viewItem == connectedConnectionTreeItem || viewItem == connectedPresetConnectionTreeItem) && mdb.isAtlasStreams == false
view == mongoDBConnectionExplorer && (viewItem == connectedConnectionTreeItem || viewItem == connectedPresetConnectionTreeItem) && mdb.isAtlasStreams == false
view == mongoDBConnectionExplorer && (viewItem == connectedConnectionTreeItem || viewItem == connectedPresetConnectionTreeItem) && mdb.isAtlasStreams == true
view == mongoDBConnectionExplorer && (viewItem == connectedConnectionTreeItem || viewItem == connectedPresetConnectionTreeItem) && mdb.isAtlasStreams == true
mdb.isCopilotActive == true && view == mongoDBConnectionExplorer && (viewItem == databaseTreeItem || viewItem == collectionTreeItem)
mdb.isCopilotActive == true && view == mongoDBConnectionExplorer && (viewItem == databaseTreeItem || viewItem == collectionTreeItem)

mongodbLanguageServer.maxNumberOfProblem.description: Controls the maximum number of problems produced by the server.

verbosity.description: Controls the verbosity of the trace.

format.description: Controls the output format of the trace.

mdb.showMongoDBConnectionExplorer.description: Show or hide the MongoDB connections view.

mdb.showMongoDBPlaygrounds.description: Show or hide the MongoDB playgrounds view.

mdb.showMongoDBHelpExplorer.description: Show or hide the help and feedback view.

mdb.excludeFromPlaygroundsSearch.description: Files and folders to exclude while searching for playgrounds in the current workspace.

mdb.defaultLimit.description: The number of documents to fetch when viewing documents from a collection.

mdb.confirmRunAll.description: Show a confirmation message before running commands in a playground.

mdb.confirmRunCopilotCode.description: Show a confirmation message before running code generated by the MongoDB participant.

mdb.useSampleDocsInCopilot.description: Enable sending sample field values with the VSCode copilot chat @MongoDB participant /query command.

mdb.confirmDeleteDocument.description: Show a confirmation message before deleting a document from the tree view.

mdb.persistOIDCTokens.description: Remain logged in when using the MONGODB-OIDC authentication mechanism for MongoDB server connection. Access tokens are encrypted using the system keychain before being stored.

mdb.showOIDCDeviceAuthFlow.description: Show a checkbox on the connection form to enable device auth flow authentication for MongoDB server OIDC Authentication. This enables a less secure authentication flow that can be used as a fallback when browser-based authentication is unavailable.

mdb.sendTelemetry.description: Allow the collection of anonymous diagnostic and usage telemetry data to help improve the product.

enumDescriptions: Save new connections globally on vscode.
Save new connections to the active workspace.
Don't save new connections (connections are lost when the session is closed).
mdb.connectionSaving.defaultConnectionSa.description: When the setting that hides the option to choose where to save new connections is checked, this setting sets if and where new connections are saved.

mdb.useDefaultTemplateForPlayground.description: Use default template for playground files.

mdb.uniqueObjectIdPerCursor.description: The default behavior is to generate a single ObjectId and insert it on all cursors. Set to true to generate a unique ObjectId per cursor instead.

mdb.browserCommandForOIDCAuth.description: Specify a shell command that is run to start the browser for authenticating with the OIDC identity provider for the server connection. Leave this empty for default browser.

mdb.presetConnections.description: Defines preset connections. Can be used to share connection configurations in a workspace or global scope. Do not store sensitive credentials here.

connectionString.description: Connection string. Do not store sensitive credentials here.

mdb.showOverviewPageAfterInstall.description: Specify whether to show the overview page immediately after installing the extension.

mdb.mcp.apiBaseUrl.description: API URL of MongoDB Atlas to be used by MongoDB MCP server for enabling Atlas tools. When empty, it defaults to 'https://cloud.mongodb.com/'. Only change this if you're using a custom Atlas deployment.

mdb.mcp.apiClientId.description: Atlas API client ID for authenticating against Atlas API. Use a Service Account (https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/configure-api-access/#grant-programmatic-access-to-an-organization) for programmatic access to Atlas APIs. Required for enabling Atlas tools in MongoDB MCP server. Store this securely and do not commit to version control.

mdb.mcp.apiClientSecret.description: Atlas API client secret for authenticating against Atlas API. Use a Service Account (https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/configure-api-access/#grant-programmatic-access-to-an-organization) for programmatic access to Atlas APIs. Required for enabling Atlas tools in MongoDB MCP server. Store this securely and do not commit to version control.

mdb.mcp.disabledTools.description: Tool names, operation types (create, update, delete, read, metadata), and/or categories (atlas, mongodb) to disable in MongoDB MCP server.

mdb.mcp.readOnly.description: When set to true, MongoDB MCP server will only allow read, connect, and metadata operation types, disabling create/update/delete operations.

mdb.mcp.indexCheck.description: When set to true, MongoDB MCP server enforces that query operations must use an index, rejecting queries that perform a collection scan. This helps prevent performance issues in production environments.

mdb.mcp.server.description: Controls whether MongoDB MCP server starts automatically with the extension and connects to the active connection. If automatic startup is disabled, the server can still be started using the 'MongoDB: Start MCP Server' command.

mdb.mcp.exportsPath.description: The directory where the MongoDB MCP server will export the data to when using the export tool. Ensure the path is writable or leave empty to use the default path.

mdb.mcp.exportTimeoutMs.description: The time in milliseconds after which the MongoDB MCP server will expire the export. Default is 5 minutes (300000ms).

mdb.mcp.exportCleanupIntervalMs.description: Controls how often the MongoDB MCP server runs the export cleanup process to remove expired files (in milliseconds). Default is 2 minutes (120000ms).
